title: Multiple Sclerosis - New Diagnosis
scope: ** Initial diagnostic workup and management of suspected or newly confirmed MS. Covers diagnostic criteria evaluation, mimics exclusion, acute symptom treatment, and DMT initiation framework. For established MS with acute relapse, use "MS - Exacerbation" template. For ongoing DMT management and monitoring, use "MS - Maintenance" template.

Extended Workup.rationale: Low levels associated with MS risk/activity
Combined NMO/MOGAD screen; cell-based assay is gold standard

Essential/First-line.item: MRI brain with and without contrast (MS protocol)*
Essential/First-line.timing: Within 24-48h if acute; within 2 weeks if stable
Essential/First-line.target: Periventricular, juxtacortical, infratentorial, or cord lesions; gadolinium enhancement = active

Essential/First-line.item: MRI C-spine with and without contrast
MRI T-spine with and without contrast

Extended.target: Prolonged P100 latency (subclinical optic nerve involvement)

Rare/Specialized.timing: If CNS lymphoma or paraneoplastic suspected

dosing.instructions: 1000 mg IV daily Ã— 3-5 days

Acute/Emergent.contraindications: Active untreated infection, uncontrolled diabetes, psychosis history
Acute/Emergent.monitoring: Glucose q6h (target <180), BP, mood, sleep, I/O

dosing.instructions: 20-40 mg daily during steroids
Per protocol if glucose >180 mg/dL
60 mg daily Ã— 7 days, then taper over 2 weeks

Acute/Emergent.contraindications: Active untreated infection, uncontrolled diabetes, psychosis history

dosing.instructions: Start 5 mg TID; increase by 5 mg/dose every 3 days; max 80 mg/day in divided doses

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Sedation, weakness; do NOT stop abruptly (withdrawal risk)

dosing.instructions: Start 2 mg qHS or TID; increase by 2-4 mg every 3-4 days; max 36 mg/day in 3 divided doses

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.contraindications: Hepatic impairment; concurrent ciprofloxacin or fluvoxamine (CYP1A2 inhibitors)
Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: LFTs at baseline, 1, 3, 6 months; sedation; hypotension

dosing.instructions: Start 300 mg qHS; increase by 300 mg every 1-3 days; target 900-1800 mg TID; max 3600 mg/day

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Sedation, dizziness, peripheral edema

dosing.instructions: Start 75 mg BID; increase to 150 mg BID after 1 week; max 300 mg BID

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Sedation, weight gain, peripheral edema

dosing.instructions: Start 30 mg daily Ã— 1 week; increase to 60 mg daily; max 120 mg/day

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Nausea (usually transient), BP, discontinuation syndrome

dosing.instructions: Start 10-25 mg qHS; increase by 10-25 mg weekly; max 150 mg qHS

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.contraindications: Cardiac conduction abnormality; recent MI; urinary retention; narrow-angle glaucoma
Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Anticholinergic effects; ECG if dose >100 mg/day

dosing.instructions: Start 100 mg BID; increase by 200 mg/day every 3-7 days; max 1200 mg/day

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: CBC, LFTs, sodium at baseline and periodically; HLA-B*1502 screening in at-risk populations

dosing.instructions: Start 300 mg BID; increase by 300 mg every 3 days; max 1200 mg BID

dosing.instructions: Start 5 mg BID-TID; max 5 mg QID

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Dry mouth, constipation, cognitive impairment (especially elderly)

dosing.instructions: 0.1-0.4 mg qHS (oral) or 10-40 mcg intranasal

Symptomatic Treatments - First-line.monitoring: Sedation; dependence; falls risk; do NOT stop abruptly

dosing.instructions: 20 mg SC daily

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: LFTs monthly Ã— 6 months, then periodically; BP; hair thinning; requires cholestyramine washout if pregnancy desired

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: CBC, LFTs, ECG, ophthalmology exam (macular edema), VZV IgG (vaccinate if negative and wait 4 weeks)
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: Bradycardia <55; 2nd/3rd degree AV block; sick sinus syndrome; QTc >500 ms; recent MI/stroke/TIA (within 6 months)
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: First-dose observation 6 hours (HR, BP q1h, ECG at 6h); macular edema screen at 3-4 months; lymphocytes; LFTs

dosing.instructions: Titration pack days 1-5, then 2 mg daily (1 mg if CYP2C9 *1/*3 or *2/*3)

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: CBC, LFTs, ECG, ophthalmology exam, VZV IgG, CYP2C9 genotype
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: Bradycardia <55; 2nd/3rd degree AV block; sick sinus syndrome; QTc >500 ms; recent MI/stroke/TIA; CYP2C9 *3/*3 genotype
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: First-dose observation 6 hours; macular edema screen; lymphocytes; LFTs; genotype required

dosing.instructions: 0.23 mg daily Ã— 4 days, 0.46 mg daily Ã— 3 days, then 0.92 mg daily

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: CBC, LFTs, ECG, ophthalmology exam, VZV IgG
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: Bradycardia <55; 2nd/3rd degree AV block; sick sinus syndrome; QTc >500 ms; recent MI/stroke/TIA; concurrent MAOIs
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: No first-dose observation required (slower titration); macular edema screen at 3-4 months; lymphocytes; LFTs

dosing.instructions: 14-day titration pack, then 20 mg daily

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: CBC, LFTs, ECG, ophthalmology exam, VZV IgG
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: Bradycardia <55; 2nd/3rd degree AV block; sick sinus syndrome; QTc >500 ms; recent MI/stroke/TIA
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: No first-dose observation required; macular edema screen at 3-4 months; lymphocytes; LFTs

dosing.instructions: Year 1: 1.75 mg/kg divided into 2 treatment weeks (week 1 and week 5); Year 2: repeat same dosing; no treatment years 3-4

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: CBC, LFTs, HIV, Hepatitis B/C, TB, VZV IgG
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: Active infection; HIV; active malignancy; pregnancy/breastfeeding; CrCl <30
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: CBC at months 2 and 6 of each treatment year; lymphopenia expected and desired; screen for malignancy

dosing.instructions: 300 mg IV every 4 weeks (or extended interval q6 weeks if stable and JCV negative)

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: JCV antibody positive with index >1.5 and prior immunosuppression (high PML risk); active infection
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: JCV antibody q6mo; MRI for PML surveillance q6-12mo; infusion reactions; REMS program required

dosing.instructions: Initial: 300 mg IV Ã— 2 doses 14 days apart; Maintenance: 600 mg IV every 6 months

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: Hepatitis B serology, TB test, immunoglobulins
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: Immunoglobulins annually; infection monitoring; infusion reactions (premedicate with methylprednisolone, antihistamine, acetaminophen)

dosing.instructions: Initial: 20 mg SC at weeks 0, 1, 2; Maintenance: 20 mg SC monthly starting week 4

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: Hepatitis B serology, TB test, immunoglobulins
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: Immunoglobulins annually; infection monitoring; self-administered at home

dosing.instructions: Initial: 150 mg IV day 1, 450 mg IV day 15; Maintenance: 450 mg IV every 24 weeks

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: Hepatitis B serology, TB test, immunoglobulins
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: Immunoglobulins annually; infection monitoring; infusion reactions (premedicate); 1-hour infusion

dosing.instructions: Year 1: 12 mg IV daily Ã— 5 consecutive days; Year 2: 12 mg IV daily Ã— 3 consecutive days (12 months after year 1)

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.pretreatment: CBC, LFTs, TSH, creatinine, urinalysis, Hepatitis B/C, VZV IgG, TB, HPV screening
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.contraindications: Active infection; HIV; ongoing autoimmune disease other than MS
Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: CBC monthly Ã— 48 months; TSH q3mo Ã— 48 months; creatinine/urinalysis monthly Ã— 48 months; REMS program; secondary autoimmunity risk (thyroid, ITP, nephropathy)

dosing.instructions: 20 mg daily or 40 mg TIW

Disease-Modifying Therapies (DMT) - OPD.monitoring: Preferred in pregnancy (no evidence of harm)

Referrals & Consults.indication: All new MS diagnoses for DMT discussion
Optic neuritis, visual symptoms, OCT baseline

Referrals & Consults.item: Physical therapy consult for gait and balance
Referrals & Consults.indication: Gait dysfunction, lower extremity weakness, falls

Referrals & Consults.item: Occupational therapy consult for ADL assessment
Referrals & Consults.indication: Upper extremity dysfunction, ADL impairment, energy conservation
Insurance navigation, disability questions, support resources
Significant functional impairment, comprehensive rehab needs
PLEX scheduling; future DMT infusion planning
Baseline macular exam before S1P modulator initiation
If atypical features, family history concerns

Patient Instructions.item: Return to ED if rapid vision loss, sudden weakness, difficulty breathing, or urinary retention
Avoid driving until cleared by neurology
Heat may temporarily worsen symptoms (Uhthoff phenomenon) - this is not a new attack
Expect temporary steroid side effects: insomnia, mood changes, increased appetite, metallic taste
Keep symptom diary noting new or worsening symptoms
Do not stop steroids abruptly if on oral taper
Do not stop baclofen or tizanidine abruptly - risk of withdrawal/rebound spasticity
Monitor blood sugars if diabetic - steroids elevate glucose
Avoid sick contacts while on high-dose steroids
Contact MS specialist before starting any new medications (drug interactions with DMTs)
Vaccinations should be completed before DMT initiation (especially live vaccines)
Pregnancy planning requires DMT discussion (some DMTs teratogenic, washout periods vary)
Report any signs of infection (fever, cough, dysuria) promptly
Post-void residual check if difficulty emptying bladder or recurrent UTIs

Lifestyle & Prevention.item: Smoking cessation (smoking accelerates MS progression and disability)
Vitamin D supplementation 2000-5000 IU daily (target serum 25-OH vitamin D >40 ng/mL)
Regular aerobic exercise 150 min/week as tolerated (improves fatigue, mood, function)
Stress management and adequate sleep (7-8 hours nightly)
Avoid excessive heat exposure (hot tubs, saunas, prolonged direct sun, exercising in heat)
Cooling vest for outdoor activities in warm weather
Maintain healthy weight (obesity associated with worse outcomes)
Limit alcohol intake (can worsen balance, cognition, bladder symptoms)
Ensure vaccinations up to date before DMT initiation (live vaccines contraindicated on many DMTs)
Fall prevention: remove loose rugs, ensure adequate lighting, use assistive devices if needed
Energy conservation techniques for fatigue management (pacing, prioritization, positioning)

differential.features: Longitudinally extensive transverse myelitis (â‰¥3 segments), severe optic neuritis (often bilateral), area postrema syndrome (intractable nausea/vomiting), brain lesions in NMOSD-typical locations
differential.tests: AQP4-IgG positive (Mayo CDS1 or NMOFS); MRI pattern different

differential.features: Bilateral optic neuritis, ADEM-like presentation, longitudinally extensive myelitis, cortical encephalitis, better steroid response, more favorable prognosis
Monophasic (usually), encephalopathy, post-infectious, large poorly-defined lesions, pediatric predominance
differential.tests: Clinical course, MRI pattern, MOG-IgG status

differential.features: Headache, encephalopathy, stroke-like episodes, multifocal infarcts
Cranial neuropathies (especially VII), hypothalamic involvement, leptomeningeal enhancement, hilar adenopathy
differential.tests: ACE level, chest CT, biopsy (non-caseating granulomas)

differential.features: Progressive course, deep gray matter/periventricular involvement, homogeneous enhancement, older/immunocompromised
Encephalopathy, hearing loss, branch retinal artery occlusions, corpus callosum "snowball" lesions
Progressive cognitive decline, tabes dorsalis, Argyll Robertson pupils, positive serology
Risk factors, vacuolar myelopathy, cognitive impairment
Subacute combined degeneration, dorsal column signs, peripheral neuropathy, macrocytic anemia
Headache history, non-specific white matter changes, no enhancement, no cord lesions
Older age, vascular risk factors, periventricular caps/halos, no enhancement, no cord lesions

evidence.recommendation: MRI brain/spine with contrast for diagnosis
CSF OCBs can substitute for dissemination in time
IV methylprednisolone 1g Ã— 3-5 days for acute attacks

monitoring.action: Insulin sliding scale; endocrine consult if persistent >250
Intermittent catheterization if >200 mL; urology referral
DMT escalation discussion if new activity
DMT escalation discussion if new activity
If positive/rising: PML risk stratification, consider DMT switch

disposition.criteria: Mild symptoms; able to ambulate safely; reliable follow-up within 1-2 weeks; no IV steroids needed OR completing outpatient infusion; stable baseline function; understands return precautions
Moderate-severe symptoms; needs IV steroids; functional decline requiring therapy; diagnostic uncertainty requiring expedited workup; unable to care for self at home
Severe myelitis with respiratory compromise (NIF >-30 declining toward -20); brainstem involvement with airway risk or autonomic instability; severe encephalopathy
PLEX needed but unavailable; MS specialist not available for complex decision-making; MRI unavailable for urgent imaging
